original: 力士生地阿夷羅跋提河邊娑羅雙樹間。
analyzed: 力士生地阿夷羅跋提河邊娑羅雙樹間。
translated: Record 27: Śākyamuni's Parinirvāṇa between the Twin Trees, from the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra. The Buddha was at the place where the Mallas lived, by the side of the Ajitavatī River, between the twin śāla trees.

original: 與大比丘八十億百千人俱。
analyzed: 與大比丘八十億百千人俱。
translated: He was with a great assembly of eighty koṭīs of myriads of bhikṣus.
They surrounded him in front and back.
On the fifteenth day of the second month, when the time for parinirvāṇa was approaching,
by the Buddha's spiritual power, a great sound came forth,
reaching as far as the peak of existence, in the language of each being.
It universally announced to all beings:
Today, the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One,
has compassion for beings like Rāhula.
He is the refuge.
The Great Awakened World-Honored One is about to enter parinirvāṇa.
If all beings have any doubts,
they can now ask about them.
This is the last time to ask.
The Chang ahan jing says:

original: 佛於毘耶離與阿難獨坐。
analyzed: 佛於毘耶離與阿難獨坐。
translated: The Buddha was alone with Ānanda in Vaiśālī.
In the latter summer retreat,
the Buddha's body became ill and his entire body ached.

original: 佛告阿難。🔽諸有修四神足多修習行常念不忘。
analyzed: 佛告阿難。 諸有修四神足多修習行常念不忘。
translated: The Buddha said to Ānanda:
Those who cultivate the four bases of supernatural power, who cultivate them much, always remember them, and do not forget them,
can attain immortality for more than an eon, according to their wishes.
Ānanda,
the Tathāgata has already cultivated the four bases of supernatural power much.
The Tathāgata can remain for more than an eon,
removing the darkness for the world and bringing peace to gods and humans.
At that time, Ānanda remained silent and did not respond.
This happened two or three times.
Ānanda was obstructed by Māra.
He was confused and did not understand.
The Buddha said to Ānanda, You should know the time has come.
Ānanda accepted the instruction, bowed to the Buddha, and left.
Before long,
Māra Pāpīyān came
and said to the Buddha, I wish to enter parinirvāṇa.
The Buddha said to Pāpīyān,
Stop, stop! I know the time myself.
The Tathāgata has not yet attained nirvāṇa.
Māra Pāpīyān again addressed the Buddha, saying:
When the Buddha first attained perfect enlightenment,

original: 我時勸請如來可般涅槃。
analyzed: 我時勸請如來可般涅槃。
translated: I then urged the Tathāgata to enter parinirvāṇa.
At that time, the Tathāgata replied,
'You must wait until my disciples have gathered.
Now is the right time. Why not enter extinction?'
The Buddha said, Stop, stop, Pāpīyān.
The Buddha himself knows the time. I will not stay long.
In three months from now,
in my birthplace of Kuśinagara,
between the twin śāla trees in the grove,
I will attain parinirvāṇa.
At that time, Māra thought, The Buddha's words are not false.
He was overjoyed and suddenly disappeared.
The Buddha then, in the Cāpāla Stūpa,
attained the samādhi of abandoning life and extended his lifespan.
At that time, the earth greatly shook.
The people were frightened and their hair stood on end.
The Buddha emitted a great light,
and the dark places were all illuminated.
Each one was able to see each other.
The Venerable Ānanda was startled and his hair stood on end.
He quickly went to the Buddha, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet,
and said to the Buddha,
How strange! The earth has moved.
What is the cause of this?
The Buddha told Ānanda,
There are eight causes for the earth to move in the world.
The earth rests on the water,
the water rests on the wind,
and the wind rests on space.
When a great wind suddenly arises in space,
then the great waters are disturbed and the whole earth moves.
This is the first cause.
Furthermore, there are times when
bhikṣus and bhikṣuṇīs who have attained the Way,

original: 及大神尊天觀水性多觀地性少。
analyzed: 及大神尊天觀水性多觀地性少。
translated: and great and venerable devas contemplate the nature of water as being abundant and the nature of earth as being few,
and wish to test their own power, then the whole earth moves.
This is the second cause.

original: 菩薩降神母胎地為大動。
analyzed: 菩薩降神母胎地為大動。
translated: When a Bodhisattva descends from the Tuṣita Heaven into his mother's womb, the earth greatly moves.
This is the third cause.

original: 菩薩從右脇生則普地動。
analyzed: 菩薩從右脇生則普地動。
translated: When a Bodhisattva is born from his mother's right side, the whole earth moves.
This is the fourth cause.
When a Bodhisattva first attains perfect enlightenment,
This is the fifth cause.
When he first turns the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma,
These are the six.

original: 佛教將畢欲捨性命則普地動。
analyzed: 佛教將畢欲捨性命則普地動。
translated: When the Buddha's teachings are about to end and he wishes to abandon his life, the entire earth shakes.
This is the seventh.
The Tathāgata wishes to enter the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder.
When he attains parinirvāṇa, the earth greatly shakes.
This is the eighth.
At that time the World-Honored One told Ānanda,

original: 俱詣香塔現在比丘普勅令集。
analyzed: 俱詣香塔現在比丘普勅令集。
translated: Let us together go to the Fragrant Pagoda and order all the present bhikṣus to assemble.

original: 如來不久是後三月當般泥洹。
analyzed: 如來不久是後三月當般泥洹。
translated: The Tathāgata will not remain for long. In three months he will attain parinirvāṇa.
When the bhikṣus heard this,
they were all shocked and confused.
They threw themselves to the ground and cried out loudly,
How could this be? The Buddha will attain nirvāṇa so quickly!
They rolled around on the ground, wailing uncontrollably.
The Buddha told the bhikṣus,
You should stop and do not be sorrowful.
Heaven, earth, people, and things - there is no life that does not end.
If you wish to make the conditioned not change,
there is no such possibility.
The celestial demon Pāpīyān has just requested me,

original: 我言是後三月當般涅槃。
analyzed: 我言是後三月當般涅槃。
translated: I said, In three months from now, I will enter parinirvāṇa.
At that time, the Venerable Ānanda
kneeling on his right knee with palms joined, addressed the Buddha, saying,
May the World-Honored One
remain for an eon and not enter parinirvāṇa.
At that time, the World-Honored One remained silent and did not reply.
In this way, he made three requests.
The Buddha told Ānanda,
You have personally heard from the Buddha
that the Buddha's four bases of supernormal power have been cultivated many times

original: 習行不忘。🔽可止不死一劫有餘。
analyzed: 習行不忘。 可止不死一劫有餘。
translated: and are not forgotten.🔽They can stop death and remain for an eon, with much benefit
and peace for gods and humans.

original: 汝爾時何不勸請如來使不滅度。
analyzed: 汝爾時何不勸請如來使不滅度。
translated: Why did you not then exhort the Tathāgata to remain and not enter parinirvāṇa?
Is your present request not too late?
I have already abandoned life and death, given it up and spat it out.
If you want the Tathāgata to go back on his word,
there is no such possibility.
At that time, the World-Honored One
emitted various lights from his face in the morning.

original: 遍照三千大千佛之世界。
analyzed: 遍照三千大千佛之世界。
translated: They illuminated the entire world system of a billion worlds.
Up to the sentient beings of the six destinies in the ten directions.
Those who encounter this light
Will have all their karmic offenses, afflictions, and vexations eliminated.
When these sentient beings see and hear this,

original: 心大憂惱同時舉聲悲號啼哭。
analyzed: 心大憂惱同時舉聲悲號啼哭。
translated: Their minds will be greatly distressed and they will simultaneously raise their voices, crying out in grief.

original: 爾時大地諸山大海皆悉震動。
analyzed: 爾時大地諸山大海皆悉震動。
translated: At that time, the great earth, mountains, and great oceans will all tremble.
Then the sentient beings will say to each other,
We should quickly go to the city of Kuśinagara
And entreat the Tathāgata not to enter parinirvāṇa.
Abide in the world for one eon or even less than one eon.

original: 諸大弟子尊者摩訶迦旃延等。
analyzed: 諸大弟子尊者摩訶迦旃延等。
translated: The great disciples, Venerable Mahākātyāyana and others,
Those who encounter the Buddha's light
Will tremble in their bodies and be unable to support themselves.
They will cry out in distress, giving rise to various kinds of suffering.
There are also eighty koṭīs of niyutas of bhikṣus
Who are all arhats like great nāga kings.
There are also sixty koṭīs of bhikṣuṇīs
Who are also great arhats.

original: 各於晨朝日初出時舉身毛竪遍體血現。
analyzed: 各於晨朝日初出時舉身毛竪遍體血現。
translated: Each, at the time of dawn when the sun first rose, their entire bodies bristled with hair and their skin turned the color of blood.
Like the blossoms of the coral tree.
Tears filled their eyes and they were overcome with great suffering.
They quickly went to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet,
circumambulated him hundreds of thousands of times, and then sat to one side.

original: 復有一恒河沙菩薩摩訶薩。
analyzed: 復有一恒河沙菩薩摩訶薩。
translated: There were also bodhisattva-mahāsattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: 位階十地日初出時遇佛光明。
analyzed: 位階十地日初出時遇佛光明。
translated: Their ranks were on the tenth ground. When the sun first rose, they encountered the Buddha's radiance.
Their entire bodies turned the color of blood and tears filled their eyes.
They quickly went to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet,
circumambulated him hundreds of thousands of times, and then sat to one side.

original: 復有二恒河沙諸優婆塞。
analyzed: 復有二恒河沙諸優婆塞。
translated: There were also upāsakas as numerous as the sands of two Ganges Rivers.
Upāsikās as numerous as the sands of three Ganges Rivers.

original: 四恒河沙毘舍離城諸離車等。
analyzed: 四恒河沙毘舍離城諸離車等。
translated: Licchavis of Vaiśālī as numerous as the sands of four Ganges Rivers.
Great ministers and elders as numerous as the sands of five Ganges Rivers.

original: 復有閻浮提內所有諸王。
analyzed: 復有閻浮提內所有諸王。
translated: There were also all the kings within Jambudvīpa.

original: 復有七恒河沙諸王夫人。
analyzed: 復有七恒河沙諸王夫人。
translated: There were also royal consorts as numerous as the sands of seven Ganges Rivers.
Excluding only King Ajātaśatru's consort.
The offerings they set up were seven times greater than before.

original: 復有八恒河沙諸天女等。🔽九恒河沙諸龍王等。
analyzed: 復有八恒河沙諸天女等。 九恒河沙諸龍王等。
translated: There were also celestial maidens equal to the sands of eight Ganges Rivers.🔽Dragon kings equal to the sands of nine Ganges Rivers.
Ghost kings equal to the sands of ten Ganges Rivers.

original: 所設供具倍於諸龍。🔽復有二十恒河沙金翅鳥王。
analyzed: 所設供具倍於諸龍。 復有二十恒河沙金翅鳥王。
translated: The offering implements set up were twice that of the dragons.🔽There were also garuḍa kings equal to the sands of twenty Ganges Rivers.
Gandharva kings equal to the sands of thirty Ganges Rivers.
Kiṃnara kings equal to the sands of forty Ganges Rivers.

original: 五十恒河沙摩睺羅伽王。🔽六十恒河沙阿修羅王。
analyzed: 五十恒河沙摩睺羅伽王。 六十恒河沙阿修羅王。
translated: Māhoraga kings equal to the sands of fifty Ganges Rivers.🔽Asura kings equal to the sands of sixty Ganges Rivers.
Anavatapta kings equal to the sands of seventy Ganges Rivers.
Rākṣasa kings equal to the sands of eighty Ganges Rivers.
They no longer ate people, and their forms became ugly.
By the Buddha's spiritual power, they all became upright.

original: 復有九十恒河沙樹林神王。
analyzed: 復有九十恒河沙樹林神王。
translated: There were also tree spirit kings equal to the sands of ninety Ganges Rivers.

original: 千恒河沙持呪王。🔽一億恒河沙貪色鬼魅。
analyzed: 千恒河沙持呪王。 一億恒河沙貪色鬼魅。
translated: Dharma-holding kings equal to the sands of a thousand Ganges Rivers.🔽Demons greedy for lust equal to the sands of a billion Ganges Rivers.
Celestial maidens equal to the sands of a trillion Ganges Rivers.
and the ghost kings of the earth, as numerous as the sands of a thousand koṭīs of Ganges Rivers;
the heavenly kings, as numerous as the sands of a hundred thousand koṭīs of Ganges Rivers,
and the Four Heavenly Kings, and so forth;
there were also, as numerous as the sands of a hundred thousand koṭīs of Ganges Rivers,
the wind gods of the four directions who blew on the trees,
causing flowers from the right and wrong seasons to scatter between the twin trees;

all had this thought:
When the Tathāgata enters parinirvāṇa and burns his body,
we should pour rain to extinguish the fire in a timely manner.

original: 復有二十恒河沙大香象王。
analyzed: 復有二十恒河沙大香象王。
translated: There were also great fragrant elephant kings, as numerous as the sands of twenty Ganges Rivers,

who held various flowers and fruits and came to where the Buddha was;
the flying bird kings, as numerous as the sands of twenty Ganges Rivers,

who held various flowers and fruits and bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet;
the buffalo kings, as numerous as the sands of twenty Ganges Rivers,

The milk flowed and filled the city of Kuśinagara.
All the ditches and pits,

analyzed: 色香美味悉皆具足二十恒河沙四天下中諸神仙人持諸香花甘果。
translated: with color, fragrance, and delicious taste all complete. Twenty Ganges Rivers of sand, in the four continents, all the divine sages held various incense, flowers, and sweet fruits.

analyzed: 稽首佛足閻浮提中一切蜂王。
translated: They bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet. In Jambudvīpa, all the bee kings,
holding various flowers, came to where the Buddha was.
Moreover, in the worlds in between,
and in Jambudvīpa, there were all the mountain spirits,
the spirits of the four great oceans and the rivers,
with great authority and virtue.
The offerings they set up were twice as excellent as before.
They scattered jasmine flowers in the Hīrī River.
They bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet and then stood to one side.
At that time, in the city of Kuśinagara,
the Sāla forest turned white like a white crane.

original: 於虛空中自然而有七寶堂閣。
analyzed: 於虛空中自然而有七寶堂閣。
translated: In the sky, there naturally appeared a seven-jeweled hall,
with carved and incised patterns,
flowing springs, bathing pools, and the most wonderful lotus flowers.
It was like the Joyful Garden of the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials.
All the devas, humans, and asuras
all witnessed the appearance of the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa.
They all felt sorrowful and mournful.
At that time, the Four Heavenly Kings and the Thirty-three Celestials,
up to the sixth heaven, set up offerings
that surpassed those before.
The Great Brahma Heaven King and the other Brahma assemblies
emitted the light of their bodies that pervaded the four continents.

original: 欲界人天日月光明悉不復現。
analyzed: 欲界人天日月光明悉不復現。

The shortest of the jeweled banners and pennants they held
hung in the Brahma Palace.

They bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet and said,

The Tathāgata knew the time but remained silent and did not accept.

original: 爾時毘摩質多阿修羅王。
analyzed: 爾時毘摩質多阿修羅王。
translated: At that time, the asura king Vemacitrin
was together with innumerable great retinue.
The light from his body surpassed that of the Brahma Heaven.
The smallest of the jeweled banners and canopies he held
covered a thousand worlds.

original: 上妙甘饍來詣佛所欲界魔王波旬。
analyzed: 上妙甘饍來詣佛所欲界魔王波旬。
translated: The demon king of the desire realm, Pāpīyān,
together with his retinue of celestial maidens,
and an asaṃkhyeya assembly,
opened the gates of hell and provided pure water.
And he said,
Now you are powerless to do anything.
You should single-mindedly contemplate the Tathāgata.
You will cause you to attain peace for a long time.
At that time, the demon Pāpīyān
completely removed the swords and immeasurable suffering and poison from hell,
and extinguished the blazing flames with rain.
By the Buddha's spiritual power, he also caused his retinue

original: 皆捨刀劍弓弩矛銏長鉤。
analyzed: 皆捨刀劍弓弩矛銏長鉤。
translated: to all abandon swords, bows, arrows, spears, long hooks,
and the weapons they held as offerings,
which were twice as excellent as those set up by all humans and gods.
The smallest canopy covered the middle chiliocosm.
They came to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet,

original: 唯願如來哀受我等最後供養。
analyzed: 唯願如來哀受我等最後供養。
translated: and said, We only wish that the Tathāgata would mercifully accept our final offerings.
In this way, they made three requests, but he still did not accept them.
At that time, Māra Pāpīyān did not get what he wished for.
He was filled with sorrow and stood to one side.
At that time, the Heavenly King Mahêśvara
together with his boundless retinue
and the offerings prepared by the heavenly multitudes
completely covered Brahmā and Śakra.
The offerings of the humans, gods, and eight groups
were like a pile of ink
next to a piece of shell, completely disappearing.

translated: The smallest jeweled canopy could cover the trichiliocosm.
They came to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet,
and circumambulated him innumerable times.
At that time, in the east,

translated: past innumerable asaṃkhyeya Ganges river sands of微塵 worlds,

translated: The Buddha was called Tathāgata Equal to Space, complete with the ten epithets.

translated: At that time, that Buddha told his foremost great disciple,

That Buddha will soon enter parinirvāṇa.
You may take this fragrant food from your world

At that time, Bodhisattva Boundless Body

translated: At that time, in this Sahā world system,

Maheśvara,

their body hairs stood on end, their throats and tongues dried up,
they were frightened and trembling, each wanting to scatter in the four directions.

original: 是時文殊師利即從坐起。
analyzed: 是時文殊師利即從坐起。
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī rose from his seat
and said to the great assembly,
You should not be afraid.
In the east,
